@MickODwyer9 Is the Russ jersey a California J1 guy just buying any jersey or do they know?
RT @MickODwyer9: Which of these jerseys I saw is more rare and unlikely to see at an Irish festival? 🇮🇪🏀
@Nabeelrend @WhyNotMeHoops That's fair enough. As I said not my world so I won't be the one making any decisions on it.
@Nabeelrend @WhyNotMeHoops But as I said I'm not a development person so I'll leave that to the pros. Just interesting discussing it
@Nabeelrend @WhyNotMeHoops Elite regional centres where kids can be challenged. Get to love the game play with friends and then separately get exposed to higher level
@Nabeelrend @WhyNotMeHoops At the same time you find a way to channel elite players into a competitive environment to challenge them and help them progress
@Nabeelrend @WhyNotMeHoops Keeping people happy as a kid when playing is way more important than any other part. Sacrificing that would be the worst thing we could do.
@WhyNotMeHoops I don't see any achievement or enjoyment out of doing that to a weak player.
@WhyNotMeHoops If it happens to you you won't be mad, but if you're coaching that strong player I think you'd find other ways to challenge them.
@WhyNotMeHoops Admittedly I don't coach very often so others are probably better placed to assess.
@WhyNotMeHoops Don't think stealing the ball ten times in a row and running in uncontested layups is helping them. More likely to make other kid quit
@WhyNotMeHoops I don't think it's a matter of telling him to hold back but we have to be able to find other ways to challenge them.
@WhyNotMeHoops Depends what you mean by underage really. Big difference between doing that at u12 and u16.
